common.too_large_input: Too large input file (should currently be under 8Mb)
common.alert_upload1: Layers have to be uploaded one by one and all mandatory files (.shp, .dbf, .shx, .prj) have to be provided for reading a Shapefile
common.alert_upload_shp: All mandatory files (.shp, .dbf, .shx, .prj) have to be provided for shapefile upload
common.layer_success: Layer successfully added to the map
common.ask_replace_dataset: An additional dataset has already been provided. Replace by this one ?
common.error_only_layout: Only layout layers can be added here
common.error_only_one: Only one layer can be added by this functionnality
common.error_existing_scalebar: Only one scale bar can be added - Use right click to change its properties

tooltips.section1: Drop a GeoJSON, TopoJSON, ziped shapefile project or KML file here or add manually a layer by clicking here
tooltips.section3:
Drop new layout layer or click to browse locally and add one.
Supported formats = shapefile (must be provided with .dbf and .prj files) GeoJSON, TopoJSON and KML

func_description.prop: Display proportional symbols with appropriate discretisation on a numerical field of your data
func_description.choroprop: Display proportional symbols and choropleth coloration of the symbols on two numerical fields of your dataset with an appropriate discretisation
func_description.choro: Render a choropleth map on a numerical field of your data
func_description.cartogram: Render a map using an anamorphose algorythm on a numerical field of your data
func_description.grid: Render a gridded density map on a numerical field of your data
func_description.flow: Render a map displaying links between features with graduated sizes
func_description.discont: Render a map displaying discontinuities between polygons features
func_description.typo: Render a categorical map with an attribute field of your dataset
func_description.label: Display and customize feature labels
func_description.typosymbol: Display symbol on the features of the maps

sample_layer_box.title: Jeux de données d'exemple
sample_layer_box.subtitle1: Choose a layer to be rendered :
sample_layer_box.subtitle2: Choose a dataset to link with geometries :

export_box.title: Choose a format...
export_box.geo: Export layers to a geographic format

join_box.title: Join options
join_box.ask_diff_nb_features:
The geometrie layer and the joined dataset doesn't have the same number of features.
Continue anyway ?
join_box.ask_forget_join: A successful join is already selected. Forget and select a new one ?
join_box.unable_join: Unable to join geometries and dataset.
join_box.error_not_uniques: The values on which operate have to be uniques.
join_box.select_fields: Select fields on which operate the join
join_box.no_match: No match found between fields {{field1}} and {{field2}}
join_box.partial_join: Partial join: {{ratio}} geometries found a match. Validate ?

add_field_box.between_numerical: Computation based on two existing numerical fields
add_field_box.join_char: Character to join the two fields (can stay blank) :
add_field_box.keep_char: Number of char to keep (from the left) :

help_box.title: Emergency help!
help_box.message_invite: Write something to be searched in the documentation :

lm_buttons.hand_button: Use the cursor to move on the map (default behavior)

intro_section.arg2: Use your own data (Shapefile, GeoJSON, kml, fichier de données tabulaire, etc.)
intro_section.arg4: Export or save your composition with ease! (SVG and PNG exports, project saving in human-readable fashion)

overview_section.list_func1: Conventional cartographic methods coupled with innovative techniques
overview_section.list_func2: (proportionnal symbols, choropleth map, discontinuity map, smoothed map, gridded map, cartogram, etc.)
overview_section.import1: Allow to use a wide range of file format
overview_section.import2: (Shapefile, GeoJSON, kml, tabular file with coordinates or tabular data to be joinded with the geographic layer, etc.)
overview_section.customize1: Customize your map as you wish
overview_section.customize2: (thanks to a large choice of projection, coloramps, fonts, and more...!)
overview_section.export_geo1: Download your newly created geographic layers
overview_section.export_geo2: (file formats and projection available for export are too numerous to be listed)
overview_section.conclusion: You might not need your favorite vector editing software !

examples_section.gallery: More examples are visible on the gallery

documentation_section.intro: A full description of each of the methods is available on the website http://onapastrouvedenom.fr. The website also includes detailed information on the technologies employed and is used to announce the latest changes.

source_section.box1_text:
The project is fully free and open-sourced (licenced under CeCILL, compatible with GNU GPL).
It's backed against a solid and modern suite of Free and Open-Source libraries (like GDAL and Python asyncio on server-side and d3.js v4 on front-end).
source_section.box2_text: Bug reports and contributions are welcome. Please use project page on GitHub.
source_section.box3_text: Code is instrumented for localization and 2 languages are currently availables.
source_section.box4_text: Project is still under developpement. More features to come, hang tight!
